name: Bench Press
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench with a barbell racked above you.
Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Unrack the bar and lower it to your mid-chest in a controlled motion.
Press the bar back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Bench Press
instructions: Set an adjustable bench to an incline of about 30-45 degrees.
Lie back on the bench and grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Unrack the bar and lower it to the upper portion of your chest.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Decline Bench Press
instructions: Set an adjustable bench to a decline position (about 15-30 degrees).
Lie down and secure your legs under the footpads.
Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it.
Lower the bar to your lower chest in a controlled manner.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Chest Fly
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand.
Extend your arms above your chest with a slight bend in the elbows.
Slowly lower the dumbbells in a wide arc until your arms are parallel to the floor.
Squeeze your chest muscles to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Chest Press
instructions: Lie back on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand at chest level.
Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended.
Lower the dumbbells back to chest level in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Machine Chest Fly
instructions: Adjust the machine handles to chest height and select an appropriate weight.
Sit with your back flat against the pad and grip the handles with a slight bend in your elbows.
Slowly bring the handles together in front of you, squeezing your chest muscles.
Return to the starting position in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
instructions: Set up a bench under the Smith machine and adjust the bar to chest height.
Lie back on the bench and grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Unrack the bar and lower it to your chest in a controlled manner.
Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Push Up
instructions: Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor.
Push through your palms to return to the starting position.
Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Arnold Press
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support and hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing you.
Press the dumbbells upward while rotating your wrists so your palms face forward at the top.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Front Raise
instructions: Stand upright with a barbell held in front of your thighs.
With straight arms, lift the barbell to shoulder height.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Delt Row
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
Bend slightly at the knees and lean forward at the waist.
Pull the barbell towards your chest, keeping elbows high.
Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cable Lateral Raise
instructions: Attach a single handle to the lowest setting on a cable machine.
Stand with your side facing the machine and grip the handle.
Raise your arm out to the side until it is parallel to the ground.
Lower the handle back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and switch sides.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
instructions: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Raise your arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position slowly.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Overhead Press
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at shoulder height.
Press the barbell overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Lower the barbell back to shoulder height in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dips (Chest Focused)
instructions: Grip the dip bars and lift yourself up to the starting position.
Lean your torso forward slightly to engage your chest.
Lower your body until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
Press yourself back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Rear Delt Flys
instructions: Adjust the pec deck machine for reverse use.
Sit facing the machine with your chest against the pad.
Grip the handles and extend your arms outward.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Face Pulls
instructions: Attach a rope handle to a cable machine at eye level.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the handles.
Pull the handles towards your face, keeping your elbows high.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Curl
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an underhand grip.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the bar up towards your shoulders.
Squeeze your biceps at the top and slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Preacher Curl
instructions: Sit on a preacher bench and position your arms over the pad while holding a barbell with an underhand grip.
Slowly curl the bar up, keeping your arms on the pad and squeezing your biceps.
Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cable Curl with Bar
instructions: Attach a straight bar to the low pulley of a cable machine.
Grip the bar with an underhand grip and stand upright with your elbows close to your torso.
Curl the bar up towards your shoulders, keeping constant tension on your biceps.
Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Cable Curl with Rope
instructions: Attach a rope handle to the low pulley of a cable machine.
Grip the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and stand upright.
Curl the rope upwards while spreading the ends apart slightly at the top of the movement.
Slowly lower the rope back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
Squeeze your biceps at the top and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Preacher Curl
instructions: Sit on a preacher bench and position your arm over the pad while holding a dumbbell with an underhand grip.
Slowly curl the dumbbell up, squeezing your biceps at the top.
Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders while maintaining a neutral grip.
Squeeze your biceps at the top and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders.
Squeeze your biceps at the top and slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Machine Bicep Curl
instructions: Adjust the seat and arm pad on the machine to fit your height.
Grip the handles with an underhand grip and keep your elbows stationary on the pad.
Curl the handles towards your shoulders, squeezing your biceps at the top.
Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Resistance Band Curl
instructions: Stand with both feet on a resistance band, holding the handles with an underhand grip.
Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the handles towards your shoulders.
Squeeze your biceps at the top and slowly lower the handles back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Barbell Row
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip a barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Bend at the hips and slightly at the knees, keeping your back straight.
Pull the barbell towards your lower chest while keeping your elbows close to your torso.
Squeeze your back muscles at the top and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and grip a barbell with an overhand or mixed grip, just outside your knees.
Keep your back straight and core engaged as you hinge at the hips and bend your knees slightly.
Drive through your heels and extend your hips to lift the barbell up to a standing position.
Squeeze your glutes at the top, then lower the barbell back to the ground in a controlled motion.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs.
Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly as you lower the dumbbells towards the ground.
Keep your back straight and engage your core throughout the movement.
Drive through your heels and extend your hips to return to a standing position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit down at a lat pulldown machine and grip the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Lean back slightly and pull the bar down towards your upper chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position with controlled movement.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: One-Handed Cable Row
instructions: Attach a single handle to the low pulley of a cable machine.
Sit or stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the handle with one hand.
Pull the handle towards your torso while keeping your elbow close to your body.
Squeeze your back muscles at the top, then slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: One-Handed Lat Pulldown
instructions: Attach a single handle to the high pulley of a lat pulldown machine.
Sit down and grip the handle with one hand, palm facing forward.
Lean back slightly and pull the handle down towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body.
Squeeze your lats at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: Cable Row
instructions: Sit down at a cable row machine with your feet firmly placed on the platform.
Grab the handle with both hands and keep your back straight.
Pull the handle towards your torso while keeping your elbows close to your body.
Squeeze your back muscles at the top, then slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Assisted Chin-Up
instructions: Adjust the weight on an assisted pull-up machine to provide assistance.
Grip the pull-up bar with your palms facing you (underhand grip).
Step onto the machine platform or band and start in a hanging position.
Pull yourself up until your chin clears the bar.
Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Assisted Pull-Up
instructions: Adjust the weight on an assisted pull-up machine to provide assistance.
Grip the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step onto the machine platform or band and start in a hanging position.
Pull yourself up until your chin clears the bar.
Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: T-Bar Row
instructions: Load a barbell into a T-bar row station or secure one end in a landmine attachment.
Straddle the bar and grip the handles with both hands.
Bend at the hips and slightly at the knees while keeping your back straight.
Pull the bar towards your torso by retracting your shoulder blades.
Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bench Dip
instructions: Sit on the edge of a bench and place your hands next to your hips.
Extend your legs straight out in front of you or keep your knees bent for assistance.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your elbows.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Skull Crushers (Dumbbells)
instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms fully extended above your chest.
Lower the dumbbells towards your forehead by bending your elbows.
Keep your upper arms stationary while lowering the weight.
Extend your arms back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Skull Crushers (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding a barbell with a narrow grip and arms fully extended above your chest.
Lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows.
Keep your upper arms stationary while lowering the weight.
Extend your arms back to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Tricep Pushdown (Bar)
instructions: Attach a straight bar to the high pulley of a cable machine.
Grip the bar with an overhand grip and stand with a slight forward lean.
Push the bar down until your arms are fully extended.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Tricep Pushdown (Rope)
instructions: Attach a rope handle to the high pulley of a cable machine.
Grip the rope with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and stand with a slight forward lean.
Push the rope down until your arms are fully extended, spreading the rope ends apart at the bottom.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Overhead Cable Tricep Extension
instructions: Attach a rope handle to the high pulley of a cable machine.
Turn away from the machine and grip the rope with both hands, palms facing inward.
Step forward and lean slightly forward while keeping your elbows close to your head.
Extend your arms fully overhead by straightening your elbows.
Slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Tricep Bodyweight Extension
instructions: Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart.
Lower your forearms down to the ground while keeping your elbows tucked in.
Push back up using your triceps until your arms are fully extended.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Close-Grip Push-Up
instructions: Start in a push-up position with your hands directly under your shoulders or slightly closer.
Lower your body while keeping your elbows close to your torso.
Push yourself back up to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bodyweight Squat
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes slightly turned outward.
Lower your hips back and down as if sitting into a chair.
Keep your chest up and knees in line with your toes.
Descend until your thighs are parallel to the ground or lower if mobility allows.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes slightly turned outward.
Lower your hips back and down while keeping the dumbbell close to your body.
Descend until your thighs are parallel to the ground or lower.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: Stand a few feet in front of a bench and place one foot behind you on the bench.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Lower your body by bending your front knee until your back knee nearly touches the ground.
Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.
